title: His future wife survived a medical emergency thanks to Boston MedFlight
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Sean Largay is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in support of Boston MedFlight, a non-profit medical transport service.
Largay's future wife, Maggie Bea, survived a critical emergency in 2024 due to Boston MedFlight's quick response.
The non-profit Boston MedFlight relies entirely on donations to continue its life-saving work.

title: He’s running the Boston Marathon to support young athletes
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Ahmed Mansour, 45, from Houston, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the Boston Athletic Academy charity.
Mansour aims to support underprivileged youth with mentorship, education, and athletics through his marathon efforts.
He is working towards completing the World Marathon Majors, with Boston being his sixth race in the series.

title: American Eagle Outfitters to close Devens distribution facility, cutting 103 jobs
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: American Eagle Outfitters will close its Devens, MA distribution facility, resulting in 103 job losses starting April 12.
The Devens center was part of Quiet Logistics, acquired by American Eagle for $360 million in 2021.
The closure is part of American Eagle's strategy to restructure logistics and prioritize its lifestyle brand portfolio.

title: Mass. lowers flags to half-staff in honor of fallen soldier Robert Arnold
author: Samantha Genzer
bullets: Flags in Massachusetts were lowered to half-staff to honor Staff Sgt. Robert R. Arnold, a 27-year-old fallen soldier.
Arnold served in both the U.S. Army and Marine Corps and was fluent in multiple languages, including German and Russian.
State Rep. Steve Xiarhos expressed condolences, noting Arnold's dedication to service and offering support to his family.

title: Healey, Ayotte spar over proposed ICE facility in N.H.
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: ICE plans to retrofit a Merrimack, N.H., warehouse into a 400-600 bed detention center costing $158 million.
Gov. Maura Healey opposes the facility, criticizing ICE's tactics, while Gov. Kelly Ayotte defends New Hampshire's interests.
Ayotte faces backlash over communication issues with ICE, leading to a state official's resignation and legal scrutiny.

title: Boy Scout rescued from Mount Washington after allergic reaction
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: A 15-year-old Boy Scout from Connecticut suffered a severe allergic reaction near Mount Washington's summit on Sunday.
First aid was administered by fellow Scouts before a park employee assisted, bringing the boy to a warm building.
Rescue teams transported the teen via Snowcat to an ambulance, which took him to Androscoggin Valley Hospital for treatment.

title: New owner steps in at Grumpyâ€™s
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Thomas Holmes, 28, takes over as the owner of Grumpy's, a breakfast spot on Route 6A in East Dennis.
Holmes plans no changes to Grumpy's, maintaining its menu, staff, and overall operations.
Holmes, involved in tech and hospitality, acquired Grumpy's but not its property; previous owner Jim Manning retains property ownership.

title: Local obituary: John Rousanidis, Peabody 33-year-old and crewmember on Lily Jean
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: John Paul Rousanidis, a 33-year-old crewmember from Peabody, passed away at sea on January 30, 2026, aboard the Lily Jean.
He was born in Salem, MA, moved to Greece at age 8, and returned to Peabody in 2016 to pursue a fishing career.
A memorial service will be held at St. Vasilios Greek Orthodox Church, Peabody, on February 20, 2026, beginning at 11:00 a.m.

title: What experts are saying about a possible Patriots trade for Maxx Crosby
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: The Patriots are considering trading for 28-year-old Raiders' defensive end Maxx Crosby, a top pass-rusher with 69.5 career sacks.
NFL insider Albert Breer notes many teams, including Super Bowl contenders, are interested in acquiring Crosby, despite Raiders wanting him to stay.
Crosby reportedly expressed interest in playing for Patriots' coach Mike Vrabel, but New England must weigh trade cost and salary cap factors.

title: Local obituary: Sgt. Freeman Short, 31-year-old Marshfield native and Lily Jean crewmember
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Sgt. Freeman Short, 31, from Marshfield, was lost at sea on January 30, 2026, while on the F/V Lily Jean.
Freeman Short was a Maine Army National Guard member, and graduated from the University of Maine in 2018.
Funeral services for Freeman Short are on February 16th and 17th in Marshfield, followed by military honors in Bourne.
